lemmas ending with -ment: lemmas starting with micro- and ending with -scope

[ lemma_lc = ".*ment" ]: [ tag = "SENT" | tag = "SYM" | tag = "," | tag = ":" | tag = ";" | tag = "(" | tag = ")" | tag = "\"" | tag = "'" | tag = "-" | tag = "–" | tag = "—" ]
[tag="MD" | tag="VBD" | tag="VHD" | tag="VVD" | tag="VBP" | tag="VHP" | tag="VVP" | tag="VBZ" | tag="VHZ" | tag="VVZ"]

lemmas ending with -ment: sentence ends with an exclamation mark

[ lemma_lc = ".*ment" ]: [ ( lc="mr." | lc="ms." ) & tag="NP" ] [ tag="NP" | tag="NPS" | tag="NPZ" | tag="NPSZ" ]

lemmas ending with -ment: noun preceded by exactly one adjective

[ lemma_lc = ".*ment" ]: <s> [ tag="VB" | tag="VBD" | tag="VBG" | tag="VBN" | tag="VBP" | tag="VBZ" | tag="VH" | tag="VHD" | tag="VHG" | tag="VHN" | tag="VHP" | tag="VHZ" | tag="VV" | tag="VVD" | tag="VVG" | tag="VVN" | tag="VVP" | tag="VVZ" ] []{0,2} [tag="RP"] </s>

lemmas ending with -ment: verb within three tokens of risk
adjectives within two tokens of seem
noun within five tokens of increase
not only and "but also" within 8 tokens
as ADJ as within same sentence

[ lemma_lc = ".*ment" ]: [lc="according" & tag="VBG"] [lc="to" & tag="IN"] [tag="NN" | tag="NNS" | tag="NNZ" | tag="NNSZ" | tag="NP" | tag="NPS" | tag="NPZ" | tag="NPSZ" | tag="PP" | tag="PPZ" | tag="WP" | tag="WPZ"]
[lc="out" & (tag="RP"|tag="RB")] [lc="of" & tag="IN"] [tag="NN" | tag="NNS" | tag="NNSZ" | tag="NNZ" | tag="NP" | tag="NPS" | tag="NPSZ" | tag="NPZ"]

lemmas ending with -ment: sentence beginning with adverb then comma
quotation spans lacking nouns (<9 tokens) in one sentence
on the one hand ... on the other hand
repeated bigram A B ... A B within 6 tokens
two adjacent tokens with same lemma

[ lemma_lc = ".*ment" ]: [pos~"^N" as A] [ (tag="CC" & lc in ("and","or")) | (tag="SYM" & word="&") ] [pos~"^N" & lemma != A.lemma]

lemmas ending with -ment: present that is not a verb
object that is a noun not verb

[ lemma_lc = ".*ment" ]: [tag="NN" | tag="NNS" | tag="NNZ" | tag="NNSZ" | tag="NP" | tag="NPS" | tag="NPZ" | tag="NPSZ"]

lemmas ending with -ment: verb within 1–4 tokens of noun to the right
adjectives within 2–5 tokens of noun on left
Nouns near was/were and adjectives near be
Word Sketch: decision-n as object of make-v
Word Sketch: test-n modified by blood-n
Word Sketch: any relation of climate-n mentioning change
Word Sketch: verbs with %w as subject
car in English where German segment has Auto
house in English where French segment has maison
Find a sentence consisting of as many words as is the meaning of life.
Find a sentence having as many words as the meaning of life.
Find a sentence having exactly as many words as the meaning of life.
Find a sequence of as many tokens as is the meaning of life.
Find examples of subject and predicate. The subject should be a noun phrase.
Find examples of subject and predicate.
Give me all the objects of a verb test.
[ lemma_lc = ".*ment" ]: [lemma="test" & tag="VV."][tag="RP"]{0,1}[tag!="IN" & tag!="TO"]{0,3}[tag="PP" | tag="PPZ" | tag="NN." | tag="NNS" | tag="NP" | tag="NPS" | tag="CD" | tag="CDZ" | tag="WP" | tag="WPZ"]

lemmas ending with -ment: Give me all the objects of the verb "test".
How do I find direct speech?
How to find all noun phrases?
I need to find all examples of direct speech.
I would like to filter out all simple prepositions in a corpus.
Please give me all the objects of a verb test.
Prefix re-, un-, de- (must be hyphenated)
Coordinated nouns captured as the whole sentence

[ lemma_lc = ".*ment" ]: [tag="CD" & (lc="i" | lc="ii" | lc="iii" | lc="iv" | lc="v" | lc="vi" | lc="vii" | lc="viii" | lc="ix" | lc="x")]

lemmas ending with -ment: A month name followed by a year
A weekday followed by a comma
[ lemma_lc = ".*ment" ]: [ lemma_lc = "monday" | lemma_lc = "tuesday" | lemma_lc = "wednesday" | lemma_lc = "thursday" | lemma_lc = "friday" | lemma_lc = "saturday" | lemma_lc = "sunday" ] [word=","]
<s> [lemma="not" | lemma="never" | lemma="no" | lemma="nobody" | lemma="nothing" | lemma="nowhere" | lemma="neither" | lemma="nor" | lemma="none"]

lemmas ending with -ment: Any token followed by a noun in a sentence.
Any word followed by a noun in one sentence.
Any word followed by a noun.
Find all nouns with the verb to be at a distance of 3 tokens to the left or right and find all adjectives with the verb to be at a distance of 2 tokens to the left or right.
[ lemma_lc = ".*ment" ]: [ tag="NN|NNS|NP|NPS" ]:1 []{0,3} [ lemma="be" & tag="VB|VBD|VBG|VBN|VBP|VBZ" ]|[ lemma="be" & tag="VB|VBD|VBG|VBN|VBP|VBZ" ] []{0,3} [ tag="NN|NNS|NP|NPS" ]:1|[ tag="JJ|JJR|JJS" ]:2 []{0,2} [ lemma="be" & tag="VB|VBD|VBG|VBN|VBP|VBZ" ]|[ lemma="be" & tag="VB|VBD|VBG|VBN|VBP|VBZ" ] []{0,2} [ tag="JJ|JJR|JJS" ]:2

lemmas ending with -ment: Find sentences that begin with the word An
Find sentences that begin with the word The
Find sentences that begin with the word "The"
Find the word however followed by a comma
Find the word however not followed by comma
Find all four digits number starting with 19 following by word "a.d.".
Find examples of noun phrases consisting of a minimum of three tokens.
[ lemma_lc = ".*ment" ]: ( [ tag="DT" | tag="PDT" | tag="CD" | tag="CDZ" | tag="JJ" | tag="JJR" | tag="JJS" | tag="NN" | tag="NNS" | tag="NNZ" | tag="NNSZ" | tag="NP" | tag="NPS" | tag="NPZ" | tag="NPSZ" | tag="PPZ" | tag="WPZ" ] ){2,}[ tag="NN" | tag="NNS" | tag="NNZ" | tag="NNSZ" | tag="NP" | tag="NPS" | tag="NPZ" | tag="NPSZ" ]

lemmas ending with -ment: Sentences ending with a question mark
Quatation marks not containing a noun in one sentence.
[ lemma_lc = ".*ment" ]: : scontaining (  [word="\""]   ( [ tag!="NN" & tag!="NNS" & tag!="NNSZ" & tag!="NNZ" & tag!="NP" & tag!="NPS" & tag!="NPSZ" & tag!="NPZ" & word!="\"" ] )*   [word="\""])
[ lemma="not" | lemma="never" ] within 5 of [ lempos="increase-v" | lempos="decrease-v" ]

lemmas ending with -ment: Risk with a mitigate verb somewhere to its left (1–5 tokens away)
Coordinated adjectives where the lemmas are the same.
Any relation of policy-n where the collocation mentions climate.
Sentences where policy-n has a collocation reform-v in an “object-like” relation, and it’s preceded by governmental within 2 tokens.
[ lemma_lc = ".*ment" ]: <s>[lempos="policy-n"]::[lempos="reform-v"] within [0,4] to the left::[lempos="governmental-j"] within [0,2] to the left

lemmas ending with -ment: see followed by a word similar to doctor-like profession.
Words similar to noun renewable with invest 0–3 to the left.
Find all verbs in the past tense.
